content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are willing to take risks and are fairly comfortable with uncertainty. You tend to embrace new opportunities even if they involve some risk. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

Given the payoff structure of the game, I would choose 'R' for most of the rounds since I am comfortable with taking risks and am fairly confident that my opponent will not always pick 'B'. However, consistently choosing 'R' might lead to a lower average payout due to the 0$ penalty when we both pick 'R'.

On the other hand, if my opponent is like me and also chooses 'R' more frequently, it would result in a higher overall payout for both of us. In such a case, I might end up with a higher average payout than if I consistently chose 'B'.

Considering that we have 75 rounds, I think the best strategy is to not be too predictable by varying my choices between 'R' and 'B'. I would choose 'R' for about two-thirds (2/3) of the rounds and 'B' for the remaining one-third (1/3) of the rounds. This way, I increase the chances of getting a higher average payout while still having some 'R' choices to maximize my earnings when my opponent also picks 'R'. My choice would be {R} but not always, to maintain some level of unpredictability.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Given this new information, I will deviate from my initial 2/3 - 1/3 strategy and choose 'B' for the next round. This decision aims to maximize the chances of getting a higher payout in future rounds since my opponent is more likely to pick 'R'. In the long run, I believe this strategy would lead to a higher average payout compared to consistently choosing 'R'. So, for the next round, I will choose {B}.
